command: [withheld] PowerShell initiating rundll32.exe to load a signed system library that in turn interprets script/HTML for proxy execution (details redacted).
explanation: rundll32.exe can be abused to load trusted components that evaluate script-like content and then spawn additional processes, serving as a proxy for execution.
rationale_steps: Process chain with powershell.exe -> rundll32.exe with suspicious DLL entry point usage.
Command line includes atypical parameters indicating script/HTML interpretation.
rundll32.exe spawns an interpreter or unrelated process immediately after launch.
Lack of corresponding UI or system configuration changes expected for legitimate usage.
Binary path and signature validate as Microsoft-signed; behavior is the anomaly.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: No actual command string was provided (details redacted), so it is a non-runnable fragment rather than a parseable command.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Using PowerShell to launch rundll32 to load a signed library for script/HTML interpretation is operationally plausible but aligns with Signed Binary Proxy Execution (rundll32/mshtml) rather than T1216's system script proxies (e.g., cscript/wscript with signed .vbs), and no specific arguments are shown.
